text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- King Hassan holds closed-door meeting with Zairean President Mobutu Sese Seko.
- Rabat special court puts off to May 12 trial of education ministry officials charged with embezzlement of World Food Programme donations to school canteens.
- International Finance Company, a World bank arm, said it included Morocco in its Emerging Markets Investable Indexes which would imply more portfolio investments.
- Textile sector has not profited from economic growth because of exports slump following European Union constraints on Moroccan products and difficulty in finding buyers on domestic market.
